title: Memoirs and correspondence of Francis Horner, M.P.
author: Horner, Francis
snippet: I thank you for your last kind and candid epistle, though it was a great deal shorter than it should have been. You would receive mine from Spott before your complaints of my silence had well got out of your hands, and have blushed, I dare say, a sufficient expiation for your uncharitableness.
